main.name: Gregory Schnese
main.description: Here will be your description. Use this to describe what you do or whatever you feel best describes yourself to a potential employer
main.bio: I analyze data and write software to hit some pretty remarkable targets. At kikin, a contextual search company, I profitably grew the userbase from 300k to 2mm MAUs. At CoPromote, a marketing service for creators, I increased recurring monthly revenue 4x. I'm currently doing the same things at Fleetio.
main.poker: Did you know the odds of flopping a flush, in hold 'em, are 1:118?
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

education.degree: Master of Science in Management and Systems
Bachelor of Science in Information Resources

work.title: Acquisition & Growth
work.description: Returned over 90% yield (value) with a paid budget of over $1mm. Doubled trial start to paying customer rate (B2B SaaS product.)

work.title: Head of Marketing
work.description: Built the marketing and growth team from the ground up and led efforts in acquisition, activation, conversion, and retention of over 700k members.

projects.title: CreatorsPromote
projects.category: Marketing for creators and influencers via cross-promotion.

projects.title: Democracy Follows
projects.category: A personalized weekly newsletter about the people who represent you in government.

projects.title: Coovents
projects.category: A presentation of Coovents at the IAC building in New York. I created the backend and API.

projects.title: Watchlr
projects.category: A presentation of Watchlr, a video saving and sharing service, created at kikin.

projects.title: Likely
projects.category: A mobile game I created that asks the question, Which is likely better?

projects.title: Drinkspottings
projects.category: A mobile app I created where you can share and take photos of your fav drinks!

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Gregory Schnese must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
